algorithms.compression_algorithms

Class HuffmanReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.Reader
      • algorithms.compression_algorithms.HuffmanReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.lang.Readable

    public class HuffmanReader
extends java.io.Reader
    BONUS - This class reads Compressed data from a Reader and returns the data. implements Reader as part of the decorator pattern.
    Author:
    Tomer Cabouly

      • read

        public int read(char[] cbuf,
                int off,
                int len)
         throws java.io.IOException
        The read function. it's not trivial. it gets compressed data from a buffer and needs to put in this buffer uncompressed data. the problem arise when considering the buffer's length is according to the compressed data size - when decompressing I have more data than the buffer can contain. with that in mind, I give the data I can - and what I cannot give - I save. in future calls this data will be returned.
        Specified by:
        read in class java.io.Reader
        Parameters:
        cbuf - - Character buffer from which compressed info will be read and decompressed info will be written.
        off - - offset to read and put chars from.
        len - - length you can read and write from and to cbuf.
        Returns:
        Integer which says how much chars were actually read.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
